headline.main: U.S. Agencies Vie to Lead the Way on Fitness

docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Government wants more people to exercise, but even as surveys show that Americans are getting more sedentary and less healthy, Federal agencies are waging a turf battle over which should have the money and the responsibility for devising and promoting a national exercise program. Among the players are the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute and the President's Council on Physical Fitness and Sports. And non-governmental groups are gearing up, as well. Among these are the American Heart Association and the American College of Sports Medicine.
